title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2206.1 - Criminal penalties
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2206.1 - Criminal penalties

State Regulations

Any person who willfully violates any provision of
section Y51-10.0 of the Rent Law shall be guilty of and punishable for a crime
as specified in section
1 (10)
of the State Enabling Act, namely, such person shall be subject to a fine of
not more than $5,000, or to imprisonment for not more than two years in the
case of a violation of subdivision c of section Y51-10.0 of the Rent Law, and
for not more than one year in all other cases, or to both such fine and
imprisonment. The administrator may certify such facts, which in his opinion
constitute such violation, to the district attorney having jurisdiction
thereof. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2206.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
